intro: Alonsoa acutifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Alonsoa acutifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
